LISD Students and Parents,

In conjunction with the final couple weeks of school assignments, LISD is offering a great opportunity to supplement your last report card for the year! LISD is committed to providing educational experiences that go above and beyond the typical “textbook” lesson. One of our main goals is to prepare students for life after school. With that in mind, we want to challenge our students with what we are calling the”Knight Challenge.” The specific details for each grade level are posted on the LISD website at www. lindsayisd.org. Each student who completes the proposed requirements for their respective grade level and who completes the appropriate survey will receive an additional grade of “100.” The assignment will be considered a daily grade within the grading process and will be applied to each class the student has.

On the web site, you will see the link for each grade level for both assignments and the survey.

Please contact your child’s respective principal if you have any questions.

post_text: April is Child Abuse Prevention month. During the monthly board meeting in April the LISD board passed a resolution to take any and all action necessary to stop child abuse in our area. The resolution also supports all city, church, and community groups and organizations who fight child abuse cases. Along with the resolution, LISD staff paid $10.00 for a week in April to wear jeans in support of the cause. We are proud that we were able to raise $437.00 that will go directly to the CASA for Kids of North Texas organization. We are thankful for CASA Director Vickie Robertson and her staff and the outstanding work they do on behalf of children in our area who are in abusive situations.
